Articles.Content:
On May 17, 2016 at 0:34 PM, WinkAllKerb'' said:

... it need some ground, so add a large garden

A bi-polar planet with south and north pole, a moon that reflect magnetic field and all, some smaller satelite as well that reflect some stuff as well, some say grab a pills gonna remove and solve (?) the bipolarity and miroring effects ...

...Planetary bodies are not buildings/structures, they do not have pills, and most planets have two poles and do not reflect "some other stuff". Therefore, the planet is already ridiculous (and not a building) and as such is disqualified. 

The building is a packaging facility...

Edited May 19, 2016 by astrokerb

... That packages packaging packers, packing packaging packing packers, packing packages. Don't try to say it more than 2 times.

My building is a Graphene manufacturer...

...that is being shut down because people keep injuring themselves running into the side of sheets of graphene, and because the global market for graphene is currently only nine million dollars USD per year.

The building is a furniture store...

 

Edited May 25, 2016 by astrokerb

...that looks like a dresser: case in point Furnitureland South.

The building is made out of an indestructible material...

On the side of a sea of molten Tungsten.

 

This (star)ship named the titanic, which just spontaneously failed to exist...

 

(Happy towel day)

Edited May 25, 2016 by icantmakemodels

Yup. It didn't not did existed.

The building is mission control...

...which is made entirely out of antennae.

The McDonalds just down the road...

...is a Starbucks in disguise.

The building is a fingernail-clipper factory...

That nails clippers onto your fingers.

A Tracking Station on Mt. Everest that has...

... nobody on it. Who would climb Everest to be paid $10/hr

 

This universe being destroyed as an exercise to the reader...

This is about buildings nit something else.

 

An indestructible silo inside the Mohole...

...is too big to fit, so it just sits on top covering it.

The bunker next to the first-tier launchpad...

Is made of dirt.

The tier 3 VAB...

...is just a very hollow structure that covers the real one.

I have a building made out p of Kerbal helmet material, that's 90 km tall and has a launch pad on the top which...

...assuming it is on Kerbin, is basically a space launchpad. 

The building is undergoing a self detonation sequence...

Edited June 15, 2016 by astrokerb

... Due to some intern who wanted to know what the big red button did.

 

This building is a airplane hangar...

On a plane.

The Gun Range...

Has bulletproof targets (but no one knows!)

The next building is a pharmaceuticals factory...

Edited June 6, 2016 by EVA_Reentry/Strangelove II

...which also makes hydrazine.

The hospital is...

On the second floor, on top of a waste treatment facility

 

The four mile deep mine shaft is...

Is burrowing into a biomass of HeLa cells.

This inconspicuous laser array...

...is run by Stormtroopers; good luck hitting anything!

This small mausoleum...

Is the actual Taj Mahal that was hit by Doofenshmirtz' Shrinkinator.

The structure is the KSC ....

Now become into Baikonur kosmodrom

The Kola Superdeep Borehole is...

...actually in the Bay of Kola in Murmansk.

The building is a sietch on Arrakis...
